page.title: 01Sodbury Common and Horton.
page.content: This area lies to the north-east of Chipping Sodbury,in the County of Avon It is mainly a rural area with most of the land being used for dairy farming,including the production of hay.The total population of the area numbers about 2000 and some of this is made up of people living in new housing in North Yate.There are three villages-Little Sodbury,Yate Rocks and Horton.The abandoned Barnhill Quarry is an important and controversial feature of the area close to Chipping Sodbury.To the north of this there is active quarrying of limestone.In the centre of the area the main feature is Chipping Sodbury Common,a large area of open space used for leisure purposes and containing Chipping Sodbury Golf Course.
